title: Arapaho Glacier
text: Arapaho Glacier is an <a href="alpine%20glacier">alpine glacier</a> in a cirque immediately southeast of <a href="North%20Arapaho%20Peak">North Arapaho Peak</a>, in <a href="Roosevelt%20National%20Forest">Roosevelt National Forest</a> in the U.S. state of <a href="Colorado">Colorado</a>. The glacier is just east of the <a href="Continental%20Divide%20of%20the%20Americas">Continental Divide</a>. Arapaho Glacier is the largest glacier in the state of Colorado and helps provide water for the city of <a href="Boulder%2C%20Colorado">Boulder, Colorado</a>. The glacier has a negative <a href="glacier%20mass%20balance">glacier mass balance</a> and lost over 52% of its surface area during the 20th Century.
